items.abstract: In vitro selection was performed to search for RNA-cleaving DNAzymes active with Cd2+ ions. All the selected, catalytically active variants turned out to belong to the 8–17 type DNAzyme.
title: In vitro selection of deoxyribozymes active with Cd2+ ions resulting in variants of DNAzyme 8–17

items.abstract: <jats:p>In the centrosymmetric dinuclear title complex, [Cu<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>I<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>(C<jats:sub>22</jats:sub>H<jats:sub>16</jats:sub>N<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>)<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>], the Cu<jats:sup>I</jats:sup> atom is coordinated in a distorted tetrahedral geometry by an <jats:italic>N</jats:italic>,<jats:italic>N</jats:italic>′-bidentate dimethyl 2,2′-biquinoline-4,4′-dicarboxylate ligand and two symmetry-related I atoms, which act as bridges to a symmetry-related Cu<jats:sup>I</jats:sup> atom. The distance between the Cu<jats:sup>I</jats:sup> atoms within the dinuclear unit is 2.6723 (11) Å.</jats:p>
title:
Di-μ-iodido-bis[(dimethyl 2,2′-biquinoline-4,4′-dicarboxylate-κ2
                  N,N′)copper(I)]
